data.title: Watch M*A*S*H Online
data.meta_description: Looking to watch M*A*S*H? Find out where to watch M*A*S*H from Season 6 at TV Guide
data.text:
72 Metascore

1972-2021

11 Seasons

CBS

Drama, Comedy

TVPG

Watchlist

Where to Watch

A multi-Emmy-winning series about Army surgeons trying to save lives, while clinging to their own sanity, in a Mobile Army Surgical Hospital during the Korean War.

Episode 1

Fade Out, Fade In (1)

Tue, Sep 20, 1977 30 mins

Part 1 of 2. Major Charles Winchester arrives at the 4077th.

Where to Watch

Episode 3

Fallen Idol

Tue, Sep 27, 1977 30 mins

Hawkeye feels responsible when Radar is wounded, but lashes out at the corporal when his own behaviour falls short of expectations.

Where to Watch

Episode 4

Last Laugh

Tue, Oct 4, 1977 30 mins

BJ learns he is under investigation by the provost marshal, but it turns out to be a practical joke by an old friend. Meanwhile, Margaret is desperate to see her husband.

Where to Watch

Episode 6

The Winchester Tapes

Tue, Oct 18, 1977 30 mins

Charles describes the 4077th in a vitriolic tape to his parents; Klinger concocts a new scheme to get out of the army; BJ has a little fun at Charles' expense.

Where to Watch

Episode 7

The Light That Failed

Tue, Oct 25, 1977 30 mins

The 4077th is left in the dark by a light-bulb shortage and also by a missing page from a murder mystery.

Where to Watch

Episode 9

Change Day

Tue, Nov 8, 1977 30 mins

Charles sees dollar signs when a scrip exchange is announced, but the process only gives Hawkeye a headache. Also, Klinger decides the best way to get out of Korea is to apply to West Point.

Where to Watch

Episode 10

Images

Tue, Nov 15, 1977 30 mins

Margaret tries to ride a softhearted nurse right out of the army; Radar wants a tattoo.

Where to Watch

Episode 11

The M*A*S*H Olympics

Tue, Nov 22, 1977 30 mins

Disgusted by the camp's lack of fitness, Potter organises a M*A*S*H Olympics with two teams captained by Hawkeye and BJ.

Where to Watch

Episode 12

The Grim Reaper

Tue, Nov 29, 1977 30 mins

Hawkeye is enraged by a ghoulish colonel who seems to love his job---predicting casualties. Meanwhile, Charles and Margaret become ill after eating canned pheasant, and Klinger reminisces with a patient from Toledo.

Where to Watch

Episode 13

Comrades in Arms: Part 1

Tue, Dec 6, 1977 30 mins

Part 1 of 2. The members of the 4077th are worried when Margaret and Hawkeye get lost in enemy territory on their way to another unit.

Where to Watch

Episode 14

Comrades in Arms (2)

Tue, Dec 13, 1977 30 mins

Conclusion. A harrowing night in enemy territory drives Margaret and Hawkeye into each other's arms, but it's not long before they're driving each other crazy.

Where to Watch

Episode 15

The Merchant of Korea

Tue, Dec 20, 1977 30 mins

When payday is delayed, BJ and Hawkeye become beholden to Charles, who assumes his generosity entitles him to many small favours.

Where to Watch

Episode 16

The Smell of Music

Tue, Jan 3, 1978 30 mins

BJ and Hawkeye go to extremes to get Charles to give up the French horn; Potter deals with a patient despondent over a facial wound.

Where to Watch

Episode 17

Patent 4077

Tue, Jan 10, 1978 30 mins

Hawkeye's search for a special surgical clamp leads to a local merchant, who also tries to replace Margaret's lost wedding ring.

Where to Watch

Episode 18

Tea and Empathy

Tue, Jan 17, 1978 30 mins

An influx of wounded British troops is made worse by the theft of penicillin, and Hawkeye clashes with the regiment's commander (Bernard Fox) over the treatment of his men. Meanwhile, B.J. tries to wean a patient from morphine. Johnson: Neil Thompson. Whitefield: Chris Winfield. Enright: Neil Hunt. B.J.: Mike Farrell. Klinger: Jamie Farr. Mulcahy: William Christopher.

Where to Watch

Episode 19

Your Hit Parade

Tue, Jan 24, 1978 30 mins

When a shipment of records arrives in camp, Radar uses the stacks of wax to help soothe nerves during a lengthy OR session. Gribble: Ronny Graham. Harker: Ken Michelman. Zale: Johnny Haymer. Patient: William Kux. Radar: Gary Burghoff. Potter: Harry Morgan. B.J.: Mike Farrell. Written by Graham.

Where to Watch

Episode 20

What's Up, Doc?

Mon, Jan 30, 1978 30 mins

Margaret confides in Hawkeye when she thinks she might be pregnant; a patient (Charles Frank) has had it with the war and wants to go home. Bell: Lois Foraker. Patient: Kurt Andon. Nurse: Phyllis Katz. Margaret: Loretta Swit. Hawkeye: Alan Alda. Radar: Gary Burghoff.

Where to Watch

Episode 21

Mail Call Three

Mon, Feb 6, 1978 30 mins

Hawkeye receives a letter for another Capt. Ben Pierce (Oliver Clark), who appears to be quite the ladies' man. Meanwhile, mail call brings unsettling news from home for others in the camp. Kelsey: Jack Grapes. Hawkeye: Alan Alda. Klinger: Jamie Farr. Radar: Gary Burghoff.

Where to Watch
